content.prompt: Which of the following best demonstrates how political parties serve as linkage institutions?

choices.label: Party leaders organize a legislative agenda and work to gain support from members to pass bills.
Parties may organize activities to identify supporters, increase registration, and get out the vote.
Parties establish interest groups to promote a specific issue.
Parties adapt over time to social changes and sometimes adopt new positions on issues.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
